groundTruth.text: The 2019-2020 global pandemic has been caused by a disease called coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). This disease has been caused by the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2). By April 30 2020, the World Health Organization reported 3,096,626 cases and 217,896 deaths, which implies an exponential growth for infection and deaths worldwide. Currently, there are various computer-based approaches that present COVID-19 data through different types of charts, which is very useful to recognise its behavior and trends. Nevertheless, such approaches do not allow for observation of any projection regarding confirmed cases and deaths, which would be useful to understand the trends of COVID-19. In this work, we have designed and developed an online dashboard that presents actual information about COVID-19. Furthermore, based on this information, we have designed a mathematical model in order to make projections about the evolution of cases and deaths worldwide and by country.

problem.title: Real-Time Data Projection for Dynamic Public Health Crisis Monitoring
problem.description: The challenge of developing computational methods to generate accurate, real-time projections of disease spread (e.g., cases, deaths) during public health crises, enabling proactive decision-making beyond static data visualization. This problem extends to other dynamic, data-driven crisis scenarios (e.g., natural disasters, economic shocks) where predictive modeling is critical for resource allocation and policy planning.

templateData.title: Technical Framework for Real-Time Data Projection in Dynamic Public Health Monitoring
templateData.description: Computational template for developing, evaluating, and deploying real-time predictive models in crisis scenarios, emphasizing statistical rigor, scalability, and operational feasibility. Designed for cross-domain adaptability (e.g., epidemiology, disaster response, economic forecasting) with quantifiable performance benchmarks.

templateProperty.label: Primary Dataset
templateProperty.description: Named dataset(s) used for model training/validation (e.g., JHU CSSE COVID-19 Data, CDC FluView). Include version if applicable.

templateProperty.label: Data Streaming Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named framework or custom pipeline for real-time data ingestion (e.g., Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis, custom API endpoints).

templateProperty.label: Temporal Resolution
templateProperty.description: Granularity of projections (e.g., hourly, daily, weekly) in ISO 8601 duration format (e.g., 'PT1H', 'P1D').

templateProperty.label: Model Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named statistical or ML model (e.g., SEIR, Prophet, LSTM, Bayesian Structural Time Series). Specify if ensemble or hybrid.

templateProperty.label: Uncertainty Quantification Method
templateProperty.description: Technique for estimating prediction intervals (e.g., Bayesian inference, bootstrapping, Monte Carlo dropout, conformal prediction).

templateProperty.label: Latency Threshold (ms)
templateProperty.description: Maximum acceptable end-to-end latency for generating projections, in milliseconds.

templateProperty.label: Forecast Horizon (days)
templateProperty.description: Maximum number of days ahead the model projects. Critical for resource planning.

templateProperty.label: Primary Evaluation Metrics
templateProperty.description: Named metrics for validation (e.g., MAE, RMSE, WIS, coverage probability). List up to 3, prioritized.

templateProperty.label: Baseline Benchmark Model
templateProperty.description: Named reference model for comparison (e.g., naive forecast, ARIMA, EpiNow2).

templateProperty.label: Data Freshness Requirement (hours)
templateProperty.description: Maximum age of input data for projections to remain valid (e.g., 6 hours for real-time systems).

templateProperty.label: Computational Budget (GFLOPs)
templateProperty.description: Maximum floating-point operations per projection cycle. Estimated or measured.

templateProperty.label: Feature Engineering Pipeline
templateProperty.description: Description of transformations applied to raw data (e.g., lag features, rolling averages, external covariates like mobility data).

templateProperty.label: Model Retraining Frequency
templateProperty.description: Interval for updating model parameters (e.g., 'P1D' for daily, 'PT1H' for hourly) in ISO 8601 duration format.

templateProperty.label: Scalability Test Results (RPS)
templateProperty.description: Requests per second handled during load testing. Report median and 95th percentile.

templateProperty.label: Deployment Environment
templateProperty.description: Named platform or infrastructure (e.g., AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, on-premise Kubernetes).

templateProperty.label: Data Privacy Compliance Framework
templateProperty.description: Named standard or regulation adhered to (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR, anonymization protocol).

templateProperty.label: Alerting Thresholds
templateProperty.description: Quantitative rules for triggering alerts (e.g., '>5% increase in 7-day rolling average').

templateProperty.label: Cross-Validation Strategy
templateProperty.description: Method for temporal validation (e.g., rolling-origin evaluation, block bootstrapping).

templateProperty.label: External Data Sources
templateProperty.description: Named supplementary datasets (e.g., Google Mobility Reports, OpenStreetMap, weather APIs).

templateProperty.label: Bias Mitigation Techniques
templateProperty.description: Methods to address sampling or algorithmic bias (e.g., reweighting, fairness constraints, synthetic data augmentation).

templateProperty.label: Cost per Projection (USD)
templateProperty.description: Estimated or measured computational cost per inference cycle.
